title: Board Game-Based Collaborative Analytical Competency Development Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in digital tools and foundational knowledge of social studies
context.additional_context: A course for in-service secondary teachers to advance collaborative analysis skills to a practically applicable level, offering immersive collaboration experiences through board game simulations

learning_goals: Learners can analyze conversational patterns that occur during collaboration through board game role-play activities
Learners can evaluate team dynamics using collaborative quality metrics (e.g., dialogue time distribution, vocal pitch synchronization)
Learners can perform topic clustering of collaborative dialogue content using digital tools and visualize semantic networks
Learners can generate feedback to improve team collaboration strategies based on analytical results
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
